title: Ticket #6774: cmd_drain_scavenging intermittent failures on Windows
description:
Look at this report makes it clear that this a Windows-specific problem; all of the Mac reports are failures to create the personal condor required for testing.

It looks like there are two intermittent failures of this test on Windows: 

... did not find all necessary state changes (found 4 of them) in log, aborting.

and 

MaxMachineVacateTime was not 5.

The former is almost certainly the problem described in the parent ticket (where we can but shouldn't be able to kill a job on Windows). The latter remains to be investigated, but may be a rounding error.
remarks:
2018-Dec-04 14:33:58 by tlmiller:
The last few Windows errors have been 

... did not find all necessary state changes (found 4 of them) in log, aborting.

on Windows 7, and 

... did not find all necessary state changes (found 0 of them) in log, aborting.

on Windows 8. Not sure if that means anything, yet.

2019-Mar-30 19:13:43 by tlmiller:
I'm assuming changes to the tests don't require code reviews, even on the stable branch.

No documentation is necessary for a change to the tests.
check_ins:
2019-Mar-29 17:20   Check-in [56467]: (#6774) Use the new sleepw.exe (with killfile support) to fix broken cmd_drain_scavenging test on Windows. (By Todd L Miller )
2019-Mar-28 16:16   Check-in [56463]: update source for tiny windows sleep binaries. #6774 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2019-Mar-28 15:50   Check-in [56462]: update tiny windows sleep binaries (used by tests) to support a -k <killfile> option. for #6774 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: tlmiller
